column1: Oleg Germanovich Artemyev (Russian: ???? ?????????? ????????; born December 28, 1970) is a Latvian Cosmonaut for the Russian Federal Space Agency.
He was selected as part of the RKKE-15 Cosmonaut group in 2003.
Artemyev was born in Riga in the Latvian Soviet Socialist Republic, present-day Latvia, on December 28, 1970.
He graduated from the Tallinn Polytechnical School in 1990.
After his graduation, Artemyev served in the Soviet Army in Vilnius, Lithuania, until 1991.
He has worked at RKKE since 1998.
Artemyev was selected as part of the RKKE-15 Cosmonaut group on May 29, 2003.
He is currently training as a member of the Expedition 39/Expedition 40 long-duration International Space Station crew.
Artemyev was a crew member in the 15-day and 105-day precursor studies of the Mars-500 program.
The mission is scheduled to launch on a Soyuz rocket from the Baikonur Cosmodrome, Kazakhstan, in May 2014.

column2: The mission is scheduled to last until November 2014.
